Class Door

  • java.lang.Object
    • Door

  • public class Door
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Erin O'Connor, Aashaka Desai, Bree McCausland, Eric Nahe, Peiyu Wang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Door(int xLocation, int yLocation, int currDoorID, int prevDoorID, int nextDoorID)
      This is the constructor for the door, and it sets the x location, y location, the currentDoor ID, the previousDoor ID and nextDoor ID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCurrDoorID()
      This is the method used to get the current door ID
      int getDoorXloc()
      This is the method used to get the x location of the door
      int getDoorYloc()
      This is the method used to get the y location of the door
      int getNextDoorIDs()
      This is the method used to get the next door ID
      int getPrevDoorIDs()
      This is the method used to get the previous door ID
      void setCurrDoorID(int currDoorID)
      This is the method used to set the current door ID- which sets the number of the scene where the door should be displayed in
      void setDoorXloc(int doorXloc)
      This is the method used to set the x location of the door
      void setDoorYloc(int doorYloc)
      This is the method used to set the y location of the door
      void setNextDoorIDs(int nextDoorIDs)
      This is the method used to set the next door ID- which sets the number of the scene after the scene where the door should be displayed in
      void setPrevDoorIDs(int prevDoorIDs)
      This is the method used to set the previous door ID- which sets the number of the scene prior to the scene where the door should be displayed in

      • getNextDoorIDs

        public int getNextDoorIDs()
        This is the method used to get the next door ID
        Parameters:
        null -
        Returns:
        nextDoorIDs- the number of the scene after the scene that the door should be displayed in- which indicates which scene the view should switch to after the player enters the door
